thread.title: Sabres top Toronto in shootout victory
thread.title_full: Sabres top Toronto in shootout victory - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Sabres top Toronto in shootout victory
text:
Photo: Gary Wiepert Image 1 of / 1   1 Buffalo Sabres left winger Johan Larsson (22), of Sweden, skates away from Toronto Maple Leafs center Nick Spaling (16) during the first period of an NHL hockey game, Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 in Buffalo, N.Y. (AP Photo/Gary Wiepert) ORG XMIT: NYGW101 Buffalo Sabres left winger Johan Larsson (22), of Sweden, skates away from Toronto Maple Leafs center Nick Spaling (16) during the first period of an NHL hockey game, Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 in Buffalo, N.Y. ... more Sabres top Toronto in shootout victory 1  /  1 Back to Gallery Buffalo 
Evander Kane tied it with 4:29 left with his first goal for Buffalo and the Sabres beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 2 -1 in a shootout Wednesday night.
Matt Moulson and Tyler Ennis scored in the shootout, while Chad Johnson made 23 saves as Buffalo improved to 2-4.
P.A. Parenteau scored and Jonathan Bernier made 34 saves as the Maple Leafs fell to 1-3-2.
Buffalo got off to a fast start, but it was Parenteau who opened the scoring when he redirected Roman Polak 's shot from the right point over Johnson's shoulder at the 1:28 mark.
Kane pushed a wrister past Bernier on Buffalo's 33rd shot of the night. Buffalo traded for Kane last February, but he didn't debut with the Sabres until this season after undergoing shoulder surgery.
Flyers 5, Bruins 4 (OT): Claude Giroux 's second goal, coming on a power play 2:09 into overtime, lifted Philadelphia to a win over Boston. The Flyers overcame a two-goal deficit in the third period before Giroux one-timed a shot past Tuukka Rask from the left circle for the winner. The Bruins were short-handed with Ryan Spooner off for hooking. Pierre-Edouard Bellemare and Sam Gagner also had goals for the Flyers. Chris Kelly , Jimmy Hayes , Brett Connolly and Patrice Bergeron scored for the Bruins, who have lost their first four games at home this season.
Notes: After an 0-7 start, the Blue Jackets fired coach Todd Richards and replaced him with John Tortorella , who coached the Rangers from 2009-13. Richards had been with Columbus since 2012. The team said Tortorella signed a three-year contract through the 2017-18 season. ... St. Louis Blues forward Paul Stastny will be sidelined at least five weeks with a broken right foot. The 29-year-old Stastny was injured in the second period of a 4-3 victory in Vancouver on Friday. He has a goal, four assists and a plus-four rating in five games. The team placed Stastny on injured reserve Wednesday.
